page.title: 05LAW AND ORDER
page.content: Hartford's local policeman is{PC {Bowden, the community policeman.}He has been in the force for 13 years and he enjoys his work. He says his job is easier now than in the past. It is well paid and there are many policemen. To become a policeman you need "O" levels, followed by two yeas of training leading to examinations. If you are accepted you serve a period of probation. You may also do a four week driving course. You will be taught self defence. PC Bowden carries a truncheon and handcuffs at all times. A modern policeman has many tasks. PC Bowden has to visit ten local schools regularly. He also deals with matters concerning road safety, Homewatch, juvenile crime and unnatural deaths in his area.
